meanings.definition: To make something individual to a particular person.
meanings.sent1: I will personalise this gift by adding their name to it.
meanings.sent2: She likes to personalise her belongings with stickers and colors.
meanings.sent3: I tried to personalise the cake with a picture, but it turned out funny.
meanings.sent4: The artist managed to personalise the painting with unique brush strokes.
meanings.sent5: Personalising the room with photos made it feel like home.

meanings.definition: To design or tailor something to meet an individual's preferences.
meanings.sent1: The company will personalise the product according to your needs.
meanings.sent2: They always personalise the menu to accommodate dietary restrictions.
meanings.sent3: I asked them to personalise my shoes, and now they have my initials on them.
meanings.sent4: She managed to personalise her workspace to boost productivity.
meanings.sent5: Personalising the schedule helped everyone stay organized.

meanings.definition: To add personal details or characteristics to something.
meanings.sent1: I will personalise the card with a heartfelt message.
meanings.sent2: He likes to personalise his car with custom license plates.
meanings.sent3: Trying to personalise the story with jokes made it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: She was able to personalise the outfit with unique accessories.
meanings.sent5: Personalising the project with creativity made it stand out.
